title: Why am I getting so much junk mail?
content: Every day, all of a sudden for about a month, I get 10 to 20 or more msgs which are and are already marked JUNK. They are from varied sources, some duplicates, but mostly new senders I've not received before. No, I don't want to have to set filters for EVERY single new one I receive. I have a life beyond setting up email controls for such an invasive problem. Why are these messages getting through to my inbox in the first place? That didn't used to happen.
creator: darleenm

title: email update
content:
I opened my email on my computer and then on another one. Now on my computer I don't receive the new incoming emails.

Please I need help
creator: missmicaela27

title: Cannot download email from server
content: A month ago, Thunderbird stopped logging onto and downloading messages from my Earthlink email server. It will still send email through this account and downloads and sends email to my Gmail account. Emails were no longer pushed to my phone as well from this account, so after troubleshooting I pointed a finger at my email and Internet providers. They tried to help, going so far as to remote onto the computer to check settings. The desktop computer is hardwired (LAN) and all mobile devices are Wifi. In the course of trying to "fix" the issue I did a hard reset of my router/modem (CX30), and emails started being pushed to my phone again. So, I may have had a security setting on the Wifi side of the router that was not compatible. However, *nothing* I can figure out will let me access the email server from my desktop computer through Thunderbird. I removed all emails from the server to get rid of corrupt email that might have blocked downloads, and manually reset all of the security settings in Thunderbird based on what I was able to find in the forums. I have switched ports from the current recommended 995 and security settings back to 110 with *no* security settings and nothing I have tried so far works. Any further suggestions?
creator: slmorrison

title: An Error Occurred
content:
Every time I try to reply to a my question on this forum I am now seeing the following message after I submit it:

An Error Occurred Oh, no! It looks like an unexpected error occurred. We've already notified the site administrators. Please try again now, or in a few minutes.

I use the latest FireFox on Win10. When looking for a solution the only one I found suggested cleaning out my cache data. I did that but it still fails. This issue started yesterday (or maybe two days ago).

Thoughts?
creator: SaratogaGap
